name: PIF
description: A physical network interface (note separate VLANs are represented as several PIFs)
obj_lifecycle: A physical network interface (note separate VLANs are represented as several PIFs)

contents.field_description: Unique identifier/object reference

lifecycle: machine-readable name of the interface (e.g. eth0)
contents.field_description: machine-readable name of the interface (e.g. eth0)

lifecycle: virtual network to which this pif is connected
contents.field_description: virtual network to which this pif is connected

lifecycle: physical machine to which this pif is connected
contents.field_description: physical machine to which this pif is connected

lifecycle: ethernet MAC address of physical interface
contents.field_description: ethernet MAC address of physical interface
MTU in octets

lifecycle: VLAN tag for all traffic passing through this interface
contents.field_description: VLAN tag for all traffic passing through this interface
actual dom0 device name
metrics associated with this PIF

lifecycle: true if this represents a physical network interface
contents.field_description: true if this represents a physical network interface

lifecycle: true if this interface is online
contents.field_description: true if this interface is online

lifecycle: Sets if and how this interface gets an IP address

ty.None: Do not acquire an IP address
ty.DHCP: Acquire an IP address by DHCP

contents.field_description: Sets if and how this interface gets an IP address
IP address
IP netmask
IP gateway

lifecycle: IP address of DNS servers to use
contents.field_description: IP address of DNS servers to use

lifecycle: Indicates which bond this interface is part of
contents.field_description: Indicates which bond this interface is part of

lifecycle: Indicates this PIF represents the results of a bond
contents.field_description: Indicates this PIF represents the results of a bond

lifecycle: Indicates wich VLAN this interface receives untagged traffic from
contents.field_description: Indicates wich VLAN this interface receives untagged traffic from

lifecycle: Indicates which VLANs this interface transmits tagged traffic to
contents.field_description: Indicates which VLANs this interface transmits tagged traffic to

lifecycle: Indicates whether the control software is listening for connections on this interface
contents.field_description: Indicates whether the control software is listening for connections on this interface
Additional configuration

lifecycle: Prevent this PIF from being unplugged; set this to notify the management tool-stack that the PIF has a special use and should not be unplugged under any circumstances (e.g. because you're running storage traffic over it)
contents.field_description: Prevent this PIF from being unplugged; set this to notify the management tool-stack that the PIF has a special use and should not be unplugged under any circumstances (e.g. because you're running storage traffic over it)

lifecycle: Indicates to which tunnel this PIF gives access
contents.field_description: Indicates to which tunnel this PIF gives access

lifecycle: Indicates to which tunnel this PIF provides transport
contents.field_description: Indicates to which tunnel this PIF provides transport

ty.None: Do not acquire an IPv6 address
ty.DHCP: Acquire an IPv6 address by DHCP
ty.Autoconf: Router assigned prefix delegation IPv6 allocation

contents.field_description: Sets if and how this interface gets an IPv6 address
IPv6 address
IPv6 gateway

ty.IPv4: Primary address is the IPv4 address
ty.IPv6: Primary address is the IPv6 address

contents.field_description: Which protocol should define the primary address of this interface

Indicates whether the interface is managed by xapi. If it is not, then xapi will not configure the interface, the commands PIF.plug/unplug/reconfigure_ip(v6) can not be used, nor can the interface be bonded or have VLANs based on top through xapi.
Additional configuration properties for the interface.

network to which this interface should be connected

msg_errors.err_doc: You tried to create a VLAN, but the tag you gave was invalid -- it must be between 0 and 4094.  The parameter echoes the VLAN tag you gave.

messages.msg_doc: Create a VLAN interface from an existing physical interface. This call is deprecated: use VLAN.create instead
msg_lifecycle: Create a VLAN interface from an existing physical interface

msg_errors.err_doc: You tried to destroy a PIF, but it represents an aspect of the physical host configuration, and so cannot be destroyed.  The parameter echoes the PIF handle you gave.

messages.msg_doc: Destroy the PIF object (provided it is a VLAN interface). This call is deprecated: use VLAN.destroy or Bond.destroy instead
msg_lifecycle: Destroy the PIF object (provided it is a VLAN interface)
